com.edinarobotics.utils.log

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.edinarobotics.utils.log.Logger

  • public final class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    The Logger class implements the client's handle to the logging system. Users of the logging system can use the Logger to submit events and to process events as they travel up the logger hierarchy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        protected Logger(java.lang.String name,
                 Logger parent)
        Constructs a new Logger with the given name and the given parent.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this logger.
        parent - The parent Logger of this Logger.

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        public Logger getParent()
        Returns the parent Logger of this logger, it it exists. The root Logger has no parent and will return null.
        Returns:
        The parent Logger of the Logger in the hierarchy.

      • getChild

        public Logger getChild(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a child Logger of this Logger by name. If the specified child logger does not exist, it will be created. The name given to this method is not fully-qualified it represents the name of the child logger only and may not contain periods or spaces.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child Logger to return.
        Returns:
        The named child Logger of this Logger.

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(Filter newFilter)
        Sets this Logger to use the specified Filter to filter log events.
        Parameters:
        newFilter - The new Filter to be used to filter log events.

      • setHandler

        public void setHandler(Handler newHandler)
        Sets this Logger to use the specified Handler to handle log events.
        Parameters:
        newHandler - The new Handler to be used to handle log events.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this Logger. This name is not fully-qualified.
        Returns:
        The name of this Logger.

      • getFullName

        public java.lang.String getFullName()
        Returns the fully-qualified name of this Logger. This name includes the names of this Logger's parent loggers and the name of the implicit root logger.
        Returns:
        The fully-qualified name of this Logger, including the root Logger.

      • getFullNameWithoutRoot

        public java.lang.String getFullNameWithoutRoot()
        Returns the fully-qualified name of this Logger, omitting the implicit root Logger. This name includes the names of this Logger's parent loggers, but omits the root Logger at the top of the hierarchy.
        Returns:
        The fully-qualified name of the Logger without the root Logger.

      • shouldHandle

        private boolean shouldHandle(LogEvent event)
        Internal method that determines whether this Logger should handle a given LogEvent.
        Parameters:
        event - The LogEvent to test.
        Returns:
        true if this Logger should handle the event, false otherwise.

      • shouldHandle

        private boolean shouldHandle(Level level,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.Throwable thrown)
        Internal method that determines whether this Logger should handle a given log event.
        Parameters:
        level - The severity level associated with the event.
        message - The String message associated with the event.
        thrown - The optional Throwable associated with the event.
        Returns:
        true if this Logger should handle the event, false otherwise.

      • handle

        private void handle(LogEvent event)
        Internal method that handles the event by passing it to this Logger's Handler, if one is defined.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to be handled.

      • log

        public void log(Level level,
                java.lang.String message)
        Submits an event to the logging system. This event will be logged as dispatched from this Logger. This event will propagate up the Logger hierarchy through each logger that approves the event.
        Parameters:
        level - The severity level of the submitted event.
        message - The message associated with the submitted event.

      • log

        public void log(Level level,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.Throwable thrown)
        Submits an event to the logging system. This event will be logged as dispatched from this Logger. This event will propagate up the Logger hierarchy through each logger
        Parameters:
        level - The severity level of the submitted event.
        message - The message associated with the submitted event.
        thrown - The optional Throwable associated with this event.

      • log

        protected void log(LogEvent event)
        Internal method used to propagate log events up the Logger hierarchy. This method handles the log event and passes it up the hierarchy if this Logger approves the event.
        Parameters:
        event - The LogEvent to be logged.
